alert.note: Alert for Le Flore (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 9:19AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Le Flore County through 945 AM CDT... At 919 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles east of Mccurtain to 8 miles southeast of Heavener Runestone State Park. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Poteau... Pocola... Heavener... Spiro... Panama... Wister... Howe... Bokoshe... Cameron... Heavener Runestone State Park... Shady Point... Rock Island... Cowlington... Scullyville... Milton... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
